input_text:
Job Title: Senior International Tax Analyst 

Location: Atlanta Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
At a Glance:This multinational conglomerate is one of the largest private companies in America and one of the wealthiest private companies globally with a top-rated tax team to match.
Everything is done in-house, so there is immense opportunity to learn and grow your skillset in the most complex and interesting topics in tax with a juggernaut in the US and global economy.
This Senior International Tax Analyst will join the local Atlanta, GA team by supporting international tax in various strategic areas. (Open to those who ae based out in Dallas, TX and Wichita, KS as we have offices in these locations as well!) 
Key Responsibilities:Review foreign income tax returns and review and prepare U.S. informational returns for foreign entities (5471, 8858, 8865) to ensure accurate reporting and compliance with domestic and foreign tax lawCalculate and review quarterly foreign inclusions (subpart F/GILTI) based on updated business forecastsTrack tax positions and their potential impacts on the company’s effective tax rateDevelop and train tax interns and/or tax analystsSupport company positions in tax audits and participate in tax planning projectsManage prioritization of multiple projects and communicate results to your supervisor and teamIdentify opportunities for innovation and share ideas for transformation that will drive value in the tax organization
Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or higher3-5+ years of international tax experienceStrong ability to review US international tax complianceIdeally a breadth of corporate international tax matters (such as: GILTI, FDII, BEAT, Subpart F, FTC, E&P)Tech-savvy (proficient with Onesource, Corptax, Gosystems, Alteryx, SAP or equivalent/similar software)
Nice to have:Master's in Taxation or AccountingCPA or Multinational corporation experienceCorptax software experience
Not convinced?Accelerate your career growth in tax with mentors from one of the top tax teams globallyEverything is done in-house, so there is immense opportunity to learn and grow your skillset in the most complex and interesting topics in taxSignificant upward mobility potentialAbility to move groups within the international tax team (compliance, accounting, planning, etc)High-growth company (90% of profits are reinvested in the business)Normal hours are consistently 40hrs per weekDuring the BUSY season hours are low (40-50hrs per week)Great culture (positive team environment with great people)Join a team where you are encouraged to offer new ideas and solutionsStrong compensation and benefits package

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Senior International Tax Analyst
output_json.summary: Join a top-rated tax team at a large multinational conglomerate in Atlanta, GA.
soft_skills: Strong ability to review US international tax compliance
job_responsibilities: Prepare U.S. informational returns for foreign entities
Calculate and review quarterly foreign inclusions
Track tax positions and their impacts on the company’s effective tax rate
Develop and train tax interns and/or tax analysts
Support company positions in tax audits
Communicate results to supervisor and team
Identify opportunities for innovation and share ideas for transformation
benefits: Ability to move groups within the international tax team
Normal hours are consistently 40hrs per week
During the BUSY season hours are low (40-50hrs per week)
Join a team where you are encouraged to offer new ideas and solutions
output_json.company_information: One of the largest private companies in America and one of the wealthiest private companies globally with a top-rated tax team.
